ygData.subject: Re: LVL10
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello, I am also a L10 wizard on Bristlebane.  I am having an enjoyable time grouping with one other player, usually L10 Ranger or L10 Rogue. Kill something
ygData.messageBody:
Hello,

I am also a L10 wizard on Bristlebane. I am having an enjoyable time
grouping with one other player, usually L10 Ranger or L10 Rogue.
Kill something big, sit down and chat awhile. I recommend the undead
pawns on the chessboard, but be careful of overcrowding. Last night
some monk tried to claim all the kills by hitting them once then
yelling kill stealer when we tried to get one out of five. I once
again proved that it is a waste of time to try to take a kill from a
wizard. (smiles proudly)

Anyway, its a matter of taste, but I like to hit a big thing and then
rest. Killing a lot of weaker stuff for exp is tough with all the
campers out there.

Let the tank do most of the damage, and then if he gets to hurting,
just phaser the MOB to the ground. Lots of fun! Then recharge at
your leisure. A little thought and that gate spell will be
unnecessary. Find a regular partner who thinks like you do.

This level I have gotten noticeable exp with almost every kill, so I
must be doing something right.

See you on Bristlebane!

Calyn


>Hi,
>
>I play a High Elf Wizard. He is currently 10th lvl. The first 9
levels went
>very quickly. I was one of the first Wizards in my area and on my
servers to
>get to 9th. Now I am finding it very difficult to get past lvl 10. I
seem to
>die every time I am on whether grouped or solo. I almost never can
get my
>gate spell off in time to get out of trouble. I do not want to
resort to
>Kill Stealing (this is very easy for a wizard)
>
>Does anyone have advice on how to advance faster. And combinations
of spells
>to use when solo or in a group. I know there are not many options
but I am
>hoping I have missed something and someone can help.
>
>I mostly adventure right now with a friend (11th level ranger) in
Crushbone.
>He seems to be sucking up most of the experience.(even when we were
at the
>same level. The rest of the time I either solo or group (30% each)
>
>Help
>
>Havil,
>High Elf Wizard of the 10th Circle
>Servant of Mithaniel Marr
>Bristlebane
>
>
>---------------------------------------------------------------------
---
>Did you know that knowledge is power?
